definition: to discuss/to comment/to criticize/to judge/to choose (by public appraisal)
round/lump/ball/to roll into a ball/to gather/regiment/group/society/classifier for a lump or a soft mass: wad (of paper), ball (of wool), cloud (of smoke)

pinyin: ping2 shen3 tuan2 te4 bie2 jiang3

sentences.english: A quorum for a Nominated Jury is three, including its President.
sentences.chinese: 提名制评审团之法定人数为三位，包括评审团主席。

sentences.english: A quorum for a Nominated Jury is three, including its President.
sentences.chinese: 提名制评审团之法定人数为三位，包括评审团主席。

sentences.english: Upon initial selection, six finalists were invited to present their papers in front of a panel of judges.
sentences.chinese: 经轮选后，六支决赛队伍须在评审团面前发表其论文。

sentences.english: After the assessment by the adjudicators , the winning entries in each Section will be chosen.
sentences.chinese: 评审团经审议后，选出每个组别的优胜队伍。

sentences.english: The decisions of the judging panel are final and no correspondence will be entered into.
sentences.chinese: 该决定的，评审团是终局的，没有函授，将进入。

definition: evaluation committee/judging panel/judging panel member/adjudicator/abbr. for 評選委員會委員|评选委员会委员[ping2 xuan3 wei3 yuan2 hui4 wei3 yuan2]
to determine the recipient of an award through discussion
to select on the basis of a vote or consensus
to get past the qualifying round/to make it to the finals
